group_1.textRight: Thanks for staying with me so late, Masara.
I'm sorry to keep you waiting for so long.

group_1.textLeft: No, your father being safe@is the most important thing.
...Also, wouldn't it have been better for you@to have gone home with your parents?

group_1.textRight: Yeah, but I thought I'd leave@them on their own today,
since they seemed to have a good mood going.
I told them it's fine if they live apart@if that's what makes them happy,
but if they're getting along,@there's nothing better than that!

group_1.textLeft: ...Sure, if you're okay with it, then I am too.

group_1.textRight: ...Ah, hey, Masara,
I didn't ask you before I told my parents...
But would you be okay with modeling@for wedding photos after all...?

group_1.textLeft: I have no problem with it,@but did you have a change of heart?

group_1.textRight: Yeah...something like that.

group_1.textLeft: Okay, let's do it. I'll ask my parents too.

group_1.textRight: Thanks, Masara!@I'll see you later, then.

group_1.textLeft: Yeah, take care.

group_1.textCenter: (...It's late, so this may be from Mother.)

group_1.narration: What time are you coming home tonight?
Apologies for being late.@I will return now.
Got it! Be safe on your way home!@When you get here I want to show you something.

group_1.textCenter: (...That reminds me, she did say@something about that earlier.)
Everything has lead up to the present...@I suppose...
That's right! There's something@I can show you regarding that...
(I wonder...@What is it that she wants to show me?)

group_1.textRight: ...I've returned.

group_1.textLeft: Ah, welcome home!
I'm glad you got back before your father did.

group_1.textRight: Does that have something to do@with what you want to show me...?

group_1.textLeft: It would be a little hard to@show in front of your father.
...Here, it's my old diary.
Our talk from earlier seemed@hard for you to swallow.
The past leading to the present...@It's difficult to explain,
but I think this will show why I believe that.

group_1.textRight: ...May I take a look?

group_1.textLeft: Of course, that's the whole reason I pulled this out.

group_1.textRight: ...Thank you.

group_1.narration: My parents brought up the subject of arranged@marriage. I'm not that keen on it,@but I did already have a chance to experience love@as a student, so I guess I might be okay with an@arranged marriage.
I was introduced to my first prospective partner.@He's quiet, not very sociable,@and I hardly understood him...@But he didn't seem like a bad person.
I decided to get married for my future prospects.@Thinking about my life and my parents,@the sooner the better.
I guess I'm getting married tomorrow...@I have no idea how I actually feel about it.@I don't know what he's thinking,@and I'm getting anxious.@Can I even do this properly...?
Today I was sick and slept the entire day away.@The rice porridge he made me wasn't very good,@but it tasted kind of like...kindness...@It's weird...
Surprise...we seem to be having a baby.@It's strange, having one in my belly.@It's the first time I've seen him look so happy.
The baby kicked!@I can't even see her,@but she still manages to be so cute.@I hope to see her soon...I can't wait!

Our baby is born! Her name is Masara.@He was crying right alongside Masara.@So much crying, so much laughing, what a hectic scene.@It was all so funny, so sweet, that I started crying too.@Today, I feel like we're finally a family.

group_1.textLeft: The people I met in the past and the connections@I made with them led me to present.
I don't think this is definitive proof...
But those worries and those choices...@It all led to right now.
So even if feelings do disappear, they may leave@something in their place...or something like that.
You can certainly call love a mood, but that isn't@all it is. That's what I wanted to tell you.
Mmm... It really is hard to explain after all...
...*Chuckle* I knew it would be,@but it's still a little embarrassing.

group_1.textRight: Why...?

group_1.textLeft: It's embarrassing to show my own daughter@the diary of my younger self.

group_1.textRight: ...And life goes on.@But, I am glad to have read it.

group_1.textLeft: Really?

group_1.textRight: ...However, truthfully, I'm more@surprised than anything.
Your reasons for marrying,@and everything about Father...

group_1.textLeft: Yeah, it was an arranged marriage,@not a marriage for love...
Are you disappointed?

group_1.textRight: The opposite, if anything.
It's hard for me to comprehend a marriage@strictly out of feelings of love.
...I had thought your reason for choosing@Father was appropriately emotional,
but your choice to marry was a realistic one,@focused on the future.
Your decision being based on logical judgment,@rather than just emotions, is what surprised me.
And your relationship with Father@is different now than it was then...

group_1.textLeft: Well, I weighed the benefits of marriage and all that,
putting a lot of thought into such things.
But now I'm really glad that we got married,@and I love your father.
If I'd just left after thinking what a weird person@he was, I wouldn't be where I am today.
Emotional choices aren't all bad, are they?

group_1.textRight: ...That's right.
...Perhaps your way of thinking@resembles mine in some ways.

group_1.textLeft: *Giggle* More like the other way around.@You take after your mother.

group_1.textRight: ...Yeah, that's true too.
...Hey, I want to hear more.@About you two, about your past.
